drupalNodeEvent.title: BIG POWER RESPONSIBILITY: How the U.S. & China can collaborate on climate change

field_speakers.processed: Barbara Finamore, Frederick Mayer, Beth Keck, Suisheng Zhao

field_description.processed: As the worldâ€™s dominant powers, the U.S. and China have a tremendous influence and impact on a global response for climate change. In this discussion we will hear from Barbara Finamore, Senior Strategic Director for Asia at the Natural Resources Defense Council, Fritz Mayer, Dean of the Josef Korbel School of International Studies at the University of Denver, and Professor Sam Zhao, Director of the Center for China-US Cooperation, on how US and China can collaborate on Climate Change for the benefit of our world.
